list_definition.definition: a thick growth of trees and plants in tropical areas

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Tigers are found in the jungles of Asia
(also adjective) The soldiers are trained in jungle warfare.

list_ex_of_english: Trading futures and derivatives, it could have been a jungle of aggressive queue jumpers, seeking to trample their fellow traders under foot.
Without a monopolistic government only the law of the jungle would apply.
The autogyro would be tested through policing the rebel-infested mountains and jungles.
At the same time we have to protect the wildlife, the natural habitats, the flora, the fauna, the jungles and the rain forests.
I look at some of the buildings for which we were responsible and ask myself whether we have in many cases created concrete jungles for people to live in.
There are long chase sequences in the jungles.
Arms will be found hidden in fields, forests and jungles.
The rain forests were considered as jungles that one had to conquer and exploit for their timber and so on.
